item.title: Building projects with Arduino CLI
item.author: embeddedk8
item.description:
In the previous post we took a closer look on build process in the Arduino IDE. It turned out that a lot of things go on behind the scenes - the classic steps of preprocessing, compiling, and linking, along with a few Arduino-specific addons to the process.

Now, let’s take a more advanced approach and build the same project without the Arduino IDE - using the Arduino CLI.

Compiling Arduino sketch via Arduino CLI

Ok, but why would we want to use CLI at the first place, when the Arduino IDE already provides such a simple way to build and upload sketches? Maybe, because of…

item.title: How the Arduino IDE builds your code – step by step
item.author: embeddedk8
item.description: As an embedded developer, you probably can’t help wondering what actually happens when Arduino IDE builds the sketch. What’s being compiled, where the files go, and how the toolchain turns the code into instructions able to run on the board?
